question: What is the incidence of beta-thalassemia in Greek population?
ideal_answer: The incidence of beta-thalassemia trait is 8% in Greek population.

snippets.text: Hemoglobinopathies are very common in Greece, the incidence of beta-thalassemia trait being 8% and that of sickle cell trait ranging from 1 to 32% in various districts.
No statistically significant differences were found in the frequency of beta-thalassaemia trait between control subjects (8.49%) and the whole Greek population.
beta-Thalassemia was found with an average incidence of 5.476% and alpha-Thalassemia with an incidence of 0.201%.

Following this program, 64,814 recruits, representing 0.651% of the total Greek population and 9.917% of the 20-year-old Greek male population, were tested. beta-Thalassemia was found with an average incidence of 5.476% and alpha-Thalassemia with an incidence of 0.201%

Following this program, 64,814 recruits, representing 0.651% of the total Greek population and 9.917% of the 20-year-old Greek male population, were tested. beta-Thalassemia was found with an average incidence of 5.476% and alpha-Thalassemia with an incidence of 0.201%.

Following this program, 64,814 recruits, representing 0.651% of the total Greek population and 9.917% of the 20-year-old Greek male population, were tested. beta-Thalassemia was found with an average incidence of 5.476% and alpha-Thalassemia with an incidence of 0.201%. Hemoglobinopathy Lepore was detected in 51 samples (0.079%) and hemoglobinopathy-S in 352 samples (0.543%).
